intro: Drimiopsis bussei, commonly known as the Zulu lily, is a bulbous perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen and can grow up to 30 cm in length. Drimiopsis bussei thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
